THE PROGRAMS
With the first program issued by the new headquarters
a different numbering system was adopted* The number contains
three elements* The first two digits indicate the year* The
next digit is the sequential number of the series in that
particular year* The last digit designates the leg* Thus*
51-3-2 means the third series distributed in 1951 to Leg #20
In addition to the number, the title of the series is always used*
The individual programs are numbered in sequence9 and, wherever
possible, titles are also used* It is hoped that by making the
designations as complete as possible some confusion will be avoided
The first series distributed, The Los Angeles County
Museum Chamber Music Concerts,was offered to only two legs* This
was done because the programs were long and in the press of
moving and getting established we were unable to get more
copies made in time* After the program started on these two
legs v/e were advised to withhold further distribution until
matters are cleared with the musicianTs union* Thus, the future
of this series is somewhat vague as this report is being written*
We have also experienced some mechanical difficulties with this
series* This will be discussed under a later section of this
report*
All of the other series have been offered to all four
legs simultaneously* The final schedules are not yet complete for
series 51-4 Cooper Union Forum, "Women”; 51-5’’Nature of the
Univers#; and 51-6 ’The New World of Atomic Energy*” Since these
are three very outstanding series it is expected that the number
of stations accepting them will be somewhat higher than for
earlier series*
